contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=February 2012}} {{notability|music|date=February 2012}} {{about|musical project|other uses|Xingu (disambiguation){{!}}Xingu}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Xingu Hill | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Belgium]], [[Canada]] | genre = [[Electronic music|electronic]], [[electronica]], [[technoid]], [[breakcore]], [[power noise]], [[intelligent dance music|IDM]] | years_active = 1995–2005 | label = [[Ant-Zen]], Delikatessen, Foton, [[Disques Hushush|Hushush]], [[Hymen Records|Hymen]], Mirex, [[Nova Zembla (record label)|Nova Zembla]], Re-Load Ambient | associated_acts = [[Ambre (band)|Ambre]], [[Ammo (band)|Ammo]], [[Dead Hollywood Stars]], [[Moonsanto]], Uncotones, Urawa | website = | current_members = [[John Sellekaers]] | past_members = }} '''Xingu Hill''' is a musical project of musician [[John Sellekaers]]. During the last ten years, John has released about forty records on various labels (such as [[Disques Hushush|Hushush]], [[Ant-Zen]], [[Hymen Records|Hymen]], [[Foton (label)|Foton]], [[Delikatessen (label)|Delikatessen]], [[Mirex (label)|Mirex]], [[Re-Load Ambient]], and [[Nova Zembla (record label)|Nova Zembla]]). Sellekaers has also recorded under names such as [[Dead Hollywood Stars]], [[Ambre (band)|Ambre]], [[Urawa (band)|Urawa]], [[Uncotones]], [[Moonsanto]] and [[Ammo (band)|Ammo]]. He has collaborated with people such as [[Black Lung]], [[Scorn (band)|Scorn]], [[The Panacea]], [[Silk Saw]] and [[Imminent]], and played many shows in [[Europe]] and [[North America]]. Since 1998, he has also running the [[Metarc]] mastering studio, currently located in [[Montreal]], [[Canada]]. == Discography == * 1995 - ''Maps of the Impossible'' (Nova Zembla, CD/2x12") * 1996 - ''Fiction'' (Nova Zembla, CD/LP) * 1997 - ''Relay'' (Nova Zembla, CD) * 1999 - ''Alterity'' (Hymen, CD) * 1999 - ''The Andronechron Incident'' (with [[Black Lung]]) (Ant-Zen, 12") * 2001 - ''This Anxious Space'' (with [[The Panacea|m²]] as xhm²) (Hymen, CD) * 2002 - ''The Andronechron Incident'' (with [[Black Lung]]) (Ant-Zen, CD) * 2003 - ''16-bit Golem'' (Mirex, 7") * 2004 - ''Unreleased Material (1995–1997)'' (The Vault, MP3) * 2005 - ''Altmann's Tongue'' (with Brian Evenson and Tamarin) (Ant-Zen, CD) == External links == *[http://www.metarc.com/ Metarc website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Xingu Hill}} [[Category:Technoid musicians]] {{electronic-music-stub}}
